page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: The most common type of farming in Libanus area is hill sheep farming. There are some cattle but they are mostly bred for slaughter for meat or breeding. A few farms have 2 or 3 cows for their home dairy supply they are milked by hand. The most popular winter food for the animals is silage and hay some buy bags of animal cake. Nearly all farmers send their yearling lambs to a milder area for winter grazing. The most popular breeds of sheep are Welsh, Suffolk and speckled. They are bred for their wool and meat. All the family help with the work on the farm, neighbouring farmers help each other at busy times such as harvest and sheering. The two main markets attended by farmers in the area are Brecon (Friday and Tuesday) and Sennybridge (Wednesday and Friday).
